selected_quotes: The 'elite' can never be a scapegoat.
My new piece in The Conversation discusses scapegoating and how it works (in a sense).
Why societies with most stretched hierarchies--UK and US--are most prone to ethnic scapegoating
This is a bitter truth. Not just in politics but also business and life in general.

citation.abstract: The 'elite' can never be a scapegoat.
citation.title: The dirty politics of scapegoating – and why victims are always the harmless, easy targets
